thread.title: China says it hopes North Korea-U.S. summit proceeds smoothly

title: China says it hopes North Korea-U.S. summit proceeds smoothly

organizations.name: central military commission of the workers' party of korea

text:
May 24, 2018 / 7:29 AM / Updated 7 minutes ago China says it hopes North Korea-U.S. summit proceeds smoothly Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
BEIJING (Reuters) - China said on Thursday that it hopes a planned summit between the leaders of North Korea and the United States can proceed smoothly, after U.S. President Donald Trump cast further doubt over whether the meeting would go ahead. North Korean leader Kim Jong Un speaks during the first enlarged meeting of the seventh Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), in this undated photo released by North Korea's Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) in Pyongyang May 18, 2018. KCNA/via REUTERS
Both countries should cherish the opportunity and all parties should ensure that dialogue leads to a positive outcome, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lu Kang said at a regular briefing. Reporting by Michael Martina; Writing by Christian Shepherd; Editing by Nick Macfie
